description: {"blocks":[{"key":"55rik","text":"Immunofluorescence staining allows detection and localization of antigens in different tissue types providing high sensitivity. The indirect immunofluorescence protocol is based on the principle of using a primary antibody binding to the target epitope, and a fluorophore-tagged secondary antibody that recognizes and binds to the primary antibody. This methods provides signal amplification allowing detection of several targets in the same tissue sample. This detailed protocol describes an adapted protocol, from An atlas of the protein-coding genes in the human, pig, and mouse brain article, for tissue staining in Tissue MicroArrays (TMA) and whole tissue Formalin Fixed Paraffin Embedded (FFPE) sections which is used in Emma Lundberg research group at Science for Life Laboratory;  KTH - Royal Institute of Technology.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":27},{"key":1,"offset":516,"length":71}],"data":{}},{"key":"bkklg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"28F745F0C10311ED81D03F9C0FCE49B7","url":"https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC6918834/#!po=90.0000"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"8F43A0B0C10311ED81D03F9C0FCE49B7","url":"https://www.science.org/doi/10.1126/science.aay5947?url_ver=Z39.88-2003\u0026rfr_id=ori:rid:crossref.org\u0026rfr_dat=cr_pub%20%200pubmed#sec-14"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"25f1o","text":"Take a coverslip suitable to cover the tissue and add the corresponding  volume (it may vary depending on the size of the coverslip).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":71,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4744e","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5vkgd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1to2r","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"c5gkm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"reagents","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"can_edit":false,"cas_number":"","guid":"A22201F0C0FD11ED81D03F9C0FCE49B7","id":205724,"linfor":null,"mol_weight":0,"name":"Fluoromount-G\u0026trade;","pubchem_id":"0","public":1,"rrid":"","sku":"00-4958-02","stats":{"total_protocols":2},"url":"https://www.thermofisher.com/order/catalog/product/00-4958-02","vendor":{"id":0,"image":{"placeholder":null,"source":"/img/vendors/440.png"},"is_requested":false,"link":"https://www.thermofisher.com","name":"Thermo Fisher"}}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":18,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"5g21i","text":"Product suggestion:  Rectangular cover glasses, VWR, cat# 631-0147.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"lqfc","text":"Take the microscope slide and remove the excess of water gently with a wipe without touching the tissue. Place it on the bench and the take the coverslip with the mounting media to cover the tissue.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ncta","text":"Leave it to dry and, afterwards, seal the edges of the slide with nail polish (avoid adding to much as it may give autofluorescence).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a4kr2","text":"Store the mounted slide in a slide box, opaque lid, and keep at 4°C until performing the image acquisition.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
